conclusion: The distance fallen during any time interval equals the area under the velocity-time (v-t) curve during that interval.
The graph shows velocity (v) in m/s on the y-axis and time (t) in seconds on the x-axis.
At t = 10s, the velocity is 20 m/s, and it decreases linearly to 10 m/s at t = 15s.
The shape under the curve from t = 10s to t = 15s is a trapezoid.
The formula for the area of a trapezoid is Area = (Base 1 + Base 2) × Height / 2.
Substituting the values: Area = (20 m/s + 10 m/s) × 5s / 2 = 75 meters.
The second image shows the area divided into rectangles (using a Riemann sum approach).
The second image confirms the calculation method is correct.
The distance fallen during the 10-15 seconds interval is exactly 75 meters, meaning it is neither greater than nor less than 75 meters.
